<<>>: PrintWriter.write <<>>: try { BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("test.txt")); String line1 = br.readLine(); String line2 = br.readLine(); PrintWriter writer = response.getWriter(); writer.print(""); writer.print(""); writer.print("HelloWorld"); writer.print(""); writer.write("
"); writer.write(line1); writer.write("
"); writer.write("
"); writer.write(line2); writer.write("
"); writer.print(""); writer.print(""); writer.close(); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } <<>>: In order to read from a file and display the first and second lines separately, you can use a BufferedReader to read the lines from the file. Then, you can use the PrintWriter to write the lines to the response.
